thread.title: "It's not over yet" - Juan Mata preaches caution after Manchester United's EFL Cup semi-final win over Hull
thread.title_full: "It's not over yet" - Juan Mata preaches caution after Manchester United's EFL Cup semi-final win over Hull

author: Alex Richards
title: "It's not over yet" - Juan Mata preaches caution after Manchester United's EFL Cup semi-final win over Hull
text:
Mata scored in an outstanding display against Hull (Photo: Matthew Peters) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Juan Mata was delighted after his man of the match display gave Manchester United one foot in the EFL Cup final. 
But after the 2-0 win over Hull at Old Trafford in the semi-final first leg, the Spanish playmaker stressed "it's not over yet". 
Marco Silva's side were resolute and unlucky not to take the lead when Adama Diomande's header hit David De Gea's right-hand post in the first half. 
But eventually United's quality told, with second half goals from Mata and Marouane Fellaini earning them a comfortable victory. In among the crowd, Mata sneaks in to give United the lead (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) 
"I think it’s a good result,” said Mata, speaking to MUTV. "It’s very important that we didn’t concede a goal because in this kind of competition it’s massive to score away. 
"We didn’t concede, we scored twice; I think Marouane’s goal was very important as well, so we are a little bit closer but it’s not over yet." Mata Celebrates putting United in front (Photo: X01095) Fellaini's header doubled United's advantage (Photo: Getty Images Europe) Read More 
United were frustrated by Hull during the first-half, as Eldin Jakupovic made a string of good saves and the Tigers rearguard stood firm to go in goalless at half-time. 
And that was reminiscent of some of United's early-season struggles, according to Mata. 
“It’s a little bit like what happened in a few games earlier this season. We were playing well, creating chances, but we were not scoring. 
“We scored twice in the second half, which is a good result for us and for me it is very important to create the chances and play good football." Read More
